results.title: Type 2014K Image Orthicon camera
results.creator_credit: Films & Equipment Ltd., Vinten and PYE Ltd.
results.brief_description: Pye cameras were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.

constellations_primary.name: News on location
constellations_primary.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Films & Equipment Ltd., Vinten and PYE Ltd.
results.description:
In 1948, Australian audiences were introduced to television at the Sydney Royal Easter Show. The British electronics company Pye had brought its 405-line cameras and monitors to encourage interest in the new medium.

While it would be eight years until Bruce Gyngell famously welcomed Australia to television, the Pye company was still essential to the burgeoning industry.

Pye cameras like this were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.

results.title: Ty's homemade band
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Phoenix Film and Evergreen Productions
results.brief_description: A stranger appears in town and helps a group of young children form their own homemade band, with the instruments made out of domestic utensils, and the children put on a concert for the neighbourhood. Ty’s one man band by Mildred Pitts Walter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Templeton, Phoenix Film and Evergreen Productions

results.title: Two/out [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kriv Stenders, Catherine Kerr and Pod Films
results.brief_description:
Jack and Tom are cellmates with a tenuous friendship. Their fragile bond begins to unravel when Jack develops dementia, and Tom, unable to understand Jack’s condition forces them into a physical confrontation which challenges the nature of their relationship.
Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two years or more
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Gilles Therien, Marc Beaudet and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An inside look at a modern federal penal institution of the kind built during the past decade, showing improvements that have been made not only in the physical facilities for housing inmates but also in the treatment and training programs. Emphasis is now placed on rehabilitation of the individual rather than on punishment for his crime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georges Dufaux, Gilles Therien, Marc Beaudet and ONF | NFB

results.title: Two women = La Ciociara (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica, Carlo Ponti, Societe Generale de Cinematographie, Cocinor and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Marceau
results.brief_description: Two women is the story of Cesira and Rosetta, mother and daughter, living in Rome and running a grocery store under grim World War II conditions. After a raid, Cesira, a beautiful widow who is propositioned at every turn, decides to relocate them to the rural village where she was born. Cesira idealises her innocent teenage daughter, attempting to shield her from the reality of war crimes and the potential danger (in particular rape) that the two face. Michele (Jean-Paul Belmondo) an idealist, who is horrified by the pettiness of the villagers, falls in love with Cesira. A love triangle forms between mother, daughter and Michele as war closes in around the village. Adapted from the Italian novel by Alberto Moravia, “Two women” effectively displays the randomness of war that can turn an individual’s fate to terror and the deprivations that reduce simple acts of kindness to bitter transactions. Sophia Loren won an Academy Award for her portrayal of Cesira, an uncommon accolade at that time. This is the dubbed version with Sophia Loren dubbing her own voice. Directed by Vittoria De Sica (The Bicycle Thief, Umberto D., Marriage - Italian style).

results.title: Two women = La Ciociara
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica, Carlo Ponti, Societe Generale de Cinematographie, Cocinor and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Marceau
results.brief_description: The story centers on a widow (Sophia Loren) who runs a tiny grocery store in Rome. When the store is bombed, she decides to return to her native village with her 13 year old daughter (Eleonora Brown). Back in her village, a timid schoolteacher (Jean-Paul Belmondo) falls in love with her. Her young daughter also secretly falls in love with him and becomes alienated from her mother because of it. While he is on a war mision, he is killed and the mother and daughter become friends once more and agree to carry on. They seek refuge in a church as they make they way back to Rome and encounter an event that will change their lives forever. Version dubbed in English. Adapted from a novel by Alberto Moravia.

results.title: Two women = Do zan [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Tahmineh Milani, Arta Film and Arman Film
results.brief_description: Two women, Fereshteh (Niki Karimi) and Roya (Marila Zare’i) become friends while studying at Tehran University. There’s a cloud of doubt over whether the university will stay open however, there’s rioting, and Fereshteh fears her future plans to become educated and enlightened will not eventuate. One day she is approached by a girl at university who wants to introduce her to Ahmad, a potential husband, she’s also being harassed by a man who follows her around campus and insists he is in love with her. One day the man sees her with her cousin and, believing him to be her lover, throws acid on him. Fereshteh is unfairly blamed for the incident and her father demands she leave university and return home. An unfortunate accident removes her harasser when he is sent to jail, but Fereshteh is held to blame also and is bailed out by Ahmad, her life and family honour indebted to him due to his financial assistance. Milani’s fifth film is an accomplished piece about a woman stifled in her attempt at liberation by a trinity involving her father, her husband, and a stranger. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Two wheeler
results.creator_credit: Len Aitken, Bill Snyder and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: This film provides a penetrating view inside the world of bicycle racing. The colour and excitement of the sport are experienced as the camera follows a race from the exhilarating start to the pressure and frustration of the finish. Dramatic camera angles and comments by the racers involve the audience in strategy and techniques. There is appealing action for the non-bicycler as well as the seasoned racer.
